title: The Good Shepherd
shortSummary: Psalm 23 is a poetic declaration of God's faithful care and provision, portraying the LORD as a shepherd who lovingly guides, protects, and blesses His people. This beloved psalm offers comfort and assurance of God's presence through life's darkest valleys and promises eternal fellowship with Him.
timeline: c. 1000 BC - Reign of King David

keyCharacters.name: David
keyCharacters.description: The author of the psalm, a shepherd-king who writes from personal experience of God's guidance and protection.

keyCharacters.name: The LORD
keyCharacters.description: Portrayed as the Good Shepherd who leads, restores, protects, and blesses His people throughout the psalm.

definitions.definition: A caretaker who guides, protects, and provides for sheep; metaphorically used for God's care over His people.
Tools used by shepherds to guide and protect sheep; symbolizing God's discipline and comfort.
To pour oil on someone’s head as a sign of being chosen, blessed, or consecrated by God.

definitions.term: Valley of the shadow of death
definitions.definition: A metaphor for the darkest and most dangerous times in life, where God's presence brings courage and peace.

outline.heading: God as Shepherd and Provider
outline.description: The psalm opens with the LORD as the personal shepherd who provides all needs, leading His people to rest and refreshment symbolized by green pastures and still waters.

outline.heading: Restoration and Guidance
outline.description: God restores the soul and leads in righteous paths, emphasizing His ongoing spiritual renewal and guidance for His people’s good and His glory.

outline.heading: Comfort in Danger
outline.description: Even in the darkest and most threatening circumstances, the believer fears no evil because God’s presence, discipline, and protection bring comfort and courage.

outline.heading: Blessing and Honor Amid Enemies
outline.description: God prepares a table and anoints the believer, symbolizing abundant blessing, honor, and divine favor despite opposition.

outline.heading: Assurance of God's Goodness and Eternal Fellowship
outline.description: The psalm closes with confident assurance that God's goodness and mercy will pursue the believer all their life, culminating in eternal dwelling in God's presence.

application: Trust God daily as your Shepherd who provides for your physical and spiritual needs.
Seek God’s guidance and restoration through prayer and obedience to His Word.
Find courage and peace in God’s presence during trials and fearful circumstances.
Live with the confident hope of eternal fellowship with God, allowing His goodness and mercy to shape your life.

keyVerses.text: The LORD is my shepherd; I shall not want.
keyVerses.significance: This foundational verse expresses complete trust in God’s provision and care.

keyVerses.text: Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil: for thou art with me; thy rod and thy staff they comfort me.
keyVerses.significance: It powerfully assures believers of God’s presence and protection in life’s darkest moments.

keyVerses.text: Surely goodness and mercy shall follow me all the days of my life: and I will dwell in the house of the LORD for ever.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights the believer’s confident hope in God’s lifelong blessing and eternal fellowship.
